meanings.definition: The quality or state of being inky.
meanings.sent1: The inkinesses of the drawing made it stand out.
meanings.sent2: The artist's work was full of beautiful inkinesses.
meanings.sent3: The inkinesses of the spilled ink created a messy situation.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were shrouded in the inkinesses of uncertainty.
meanings.sent5: The inkinesses of the night sky were mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: The presence of ink or ink-like substances.
meanings.sent1: The inkinesses on the paper indicated a recent spill.
meanings.sent2: The printer was running low on inkinesses.
meanings.sent3: The detective found traces of inkinesses at the crime scene.
meanings.sent4: The letter was stained with the inkinesses of a leaky pen.
meanings.sent5: The artist carefully mixed different inkinesses to create a unique shade.

meanings.definition: The darkness or blackness of ink.
meanings.sent1: The inkinesses of the text made it hard to read.
meanings.sent2: The calligraphy stood out due to its deep inkinesses.
meanings.sent3: The cat left paw prints in the inkinesses on the floor.
meanings.sent4: The old photograph had faded inkinesses.
meanings.sent5: The inkinesses of the storm clouds signaled heavy rain.
